function_call.name: write_files

message.content:
The failure in the generated code seems to be due to the incorrect usage of the 'decode' method on a string object in both the application and test files. The 'decode' method is not a valid method for a string object in Python, which is causing the AttributeError. 

Plan: 
To mitigate this issue, I will remove the 'decode' method from the JWT token generation in the application file and the test file. The JWT encode method returns a string in Python 3, so there is no need to decode it. I will then regenerate the code and run the tests again to ensure that the issue has been resolved.

message.content:
The failure in the generated code seems to be due to the missing 'flask_jwt_extended' module. This module is not installed in the environment, causing the ImportError. 

Plan: 
To mitigate this issue, I will include a requirements.txt file that lists all the necessary dependencies for the project, including 'flask_jwt_extended'. This will ensure that all necessary modules are installed when setting up the environment for the project. I will then regenerate the code and run the tests again to ensure that the issue has been resolved.
